VectorProperties.Title: GRAND Unique ID
VectorProperties.Description: Unique ID for each point representing a dam and its associated reservoir; the point location is an approximation of the dam location.

VectorProperties.Title: Dam Name
VectorProperties.Description: Name of dam structure.

VectorProperties.Title: River
VectorProperties.Description: Name of impounded river

VectorProperties.Title: Main Basin
VectorProperties.Description: Name of main basin

VectorProperties.Title: Sub-basin
VectorProperties.Description: Name of sub-basin

VectorProperties.Title: Main Use
VectorProperties.Description:
Main purpose of reservoir:
  • Irrigation; Hydroelectricity; Water supply; Flood control; Recreation;
  • Navigation; Fisheries; Pollution control; Livestock; or Other

VectorProperties.Title: Representative Capacity
VectorProperties.Description: Representative maximum storage capacity of reservoir in million cubic meters; consolidated from other 'Cap' columns in the following order of priority: 'Cap_max' over 'Cap_rep' over 'Cap_min'; exceptions apply if value in 'Cap_max' column seems unreliable or rounded.

VectorProperties.Title: Representative Surface Area
VectorProperties.Description: Representative surface area of reservoir in square kilometers; consolidated from other 'Area' columns in the following order of priority: 'Area_poly' over 'Area_rep' over 'Area_max' over 'Area_min'; exceptions apply if value in 'Area_poly' column seems unreliable or rounded.

VectorProperties.Title: Calculated Upstream Catchment Area
VectorProperties.Description: Area of upstream catchment draining into the reservoir in square kilometers; value derived from HydroSHEDS at 15s resolution at point location of dam.

VectorProperties.Title: Dam Height
VectorProperties.Description: Height of dam in meters.

VectorProperties.Title: Dam Length
VectorProperties.Description: Length of dam in meters.

VectorProperties.Title: Depth
VectorProperties.Description: Average depth of reservoir in meters; calculated as ratio between storage capacity ('Cap_mcm') and surface area ('Area_skm'); values that are somewhat higher than the dam height ('Dam_hgt_m') may still be reasonable, e.g. if the storage capacity refers to the maximum volume yet the reservoir polygon represents a low-fill status; values capped at 1,000 indicate exceedingly high values, which may be due to inconsistencies in the data.

VectorProperties.Title: Average Discharge
VectorProperties.Description: Long-term (1961-90) average discharge at reservoir location in liters per second; value derived from HydroSHEDS flow routing scheme combined with WaterGAP2 runoff estimates at 15s resolution at point location of dam.

VectorProperties.Title: Latitude
VectorProperties.Description: Latitude in Decimal Degrees

VectorProperties.Title: Longitude
VectorProperties.Description: Longitude in Decimal Degrees

VectorProperties.Title: Grid Identifier
VectorProperties.Description: Grid Identifier

VectorProperties.Title: Grid Element Type
VectorProperties.Description: Grid Element Type

VectorProperties.Title: Feature ID
VectorProperties.Description: Unique ID for each grid element.

VectorProperties.Title: Time
VectorProperties.Description: A default label containing the orbit track element’s time of day (24hr:mi) with optional day offset (e.g. ‘01:28 (+1)’).

VectorProperties.Title: Date & Time
VectorProperties.Description: The full date and time of the orbit track element (e.g. ‘2019/09/12 18:58:00+00’).

VectorProperties.Title: Day/Night Flag
VectorProperties.Description: Indicates whether the satellite was retrieving data in a 'Day', 'Night', or 'Both' (Transitional) state.  For non-sun synchronous orbits, a value of 'N/A' is provided.

VectorProperties.Title: Direction of Travel
VectorProperties.Description: Indicates whether the satellite is ascending, descending, or transitioning between directions.

VectorProperties.Title: Identifier
VectorProperties.Description: A unique identifier for the orbit track element.

VectorProperties.Title: Hour
VectorProperties.Description: Integer value for the hour component of the Datetime attribute.

VectorProperties.Title: Minute
VectorProperties.Description: Integer value for the minute component of the Datetime attribute.

VectorProperties.Title: Day Offset
VectorProperties.Description: Indicates whether the orbit track element represents a datetime that is before ('-1'), equal to ('0'), or after ('+1') the requested data day.

VectorProperties.Title: Brightness Temperature (Channel I-4)

VectorProperties.Title: Brightness Temperature (Channel I-5)
VectorProperties.Description: Channel I-5 brightness temperature of the fire pixel, measured in Kelvin.

VectorProperties.Title: Fire Radiative Power
VectorProperties.Description: The Fire Radiative Power (FRP) is a measure of the rate of radiant heat output from a fire. It has been demonstrated in small-scale experimental fires that the FRP of a fire is related to the rate at which fuel is being consumed (Wooster et al., 2005) and smoke emissions released (Freeborn et al., 2008).

VectorProperties.Title: Detection Confidence
VectorProperties.Description: This value is based on a collection of intermediate algorithm quantities used in the detection process. It is intended to help users gauge the quality of individual hotspot/fire pixels. Confidence values are set to low, nominal and high.  Low confidence daytime fire pixels are typically associated with areas of sun glint and lower relative temperature anomaly (<15K) in the mid-infrared channel I4. Nominal confidence pixels are those free of potential sun glint contamination during the day and marked by strong (>15K) temperature anomaly in either day or nighttime data. High confidence fire pixels are associated with day or nighttime saturated pixels.

VectorProperties.Title: Day/Night Flag
VectorProperties.Description: Indicates whether the fire point was observed during the ‘day’ or ‘night’.

VectorProperties.Title: Along-Scan Pixel Size
VectorProperties.Description: The algorithm produces 375m pixels at nadir, but pixels get bigger toward the edge of scan. This value reflects the actual along-scan pixel size.

VectorProperties.Title: Along-Track Pixel Size
VectorProperties.Description: The algorithm produces 375m pixels at nadir, but pixels get bigger toward the edge of scan. This value reflects the actual along-track pixel size.

VectorProperties.Title: Acquisition Date
VectorProperties.Description: The date of acquisition for this fire point. (YYYY-MM-DD)

VectorProperties.Title: Acquisition Time
VectorProperties.Description: The time of acquisition for this fire point, in UTC. (HHMM)

VectorProperties.Title: Inferred Hot Spot Type
VectorProperties.Description: The inferred type of the detected hot spot.

VectorProperties.Title: Fire Radiative Power
VectorProperties.Description: The Fire Radiative Power (FRP) is a measure of the rate of radiant heat output from a fire. It has been demonstrated in small-scale experimental fires that the FRP of a fire is related to the rate at which fuel is being consumed (Wooster et al., 2005) and smoke emissions released (Freeborn et al., 2008).

VectorProperties.Title: Detection Confidence
VectorProperties.Description: This value is based on a collection of intermediate algorithm quantities used in the detection process. It is intended to help users gauge the quality of individual hotspot/fire pixels. Confidence values are set to low, nominal and high.  Low confidence daytime fire pixels are typically associated with areas of sun glint and lower relative temperature anomaly (<15K) in the mid-infrared channel I4. Nominal confidence pixels are those free of potential sun glint contamination during the day and marked by strong (>15K) temperature anomaly in either day or nighttime data. High confidence fire pixels are associated with day or nighttime saturated pixels.
